channel.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
channel.description:
Hi. I was wondering if anyone here knows how to make an arrow fly through the air. I'm trying to implement it into my attack method if the player is using range. I've seen on other servers, the arrow is loaded in the right direction, and it flys straight through the air at the enemy.
On my server, the arrow always loads facing south, no matter what direction you are facing, and instead of flying straight through the air, the graphic of the arrow loading loops, causing a weird bumpy shot.
If anyone knows ANYTHING about this, please post. It would be... Greatly appreciated.... ++
Thanks, Unborn

item.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @bencorbett bencorbett
item.description:
@bencorbett wrote:

If you read above, I said that i have read 3 gfx lists and none contained the animations for an arrow in the air, only one being fired…

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @simon simon
item.description:
@simon wrote:

You will need to find a gfx.txt file somewhere that says all the animation emotes for shooting arrows and replace them with your current ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @bencorbett bencorbett
item.description:
@bencorbett wrote:

Lol ok… I currently use createProjectile(casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 95, 18, 43, 0, Lockon);
Caster X/Y being coords of the shooter, offsetX/Y being the distance, 50 the angle, 95 the speed, 18 the iron arrow graphic, 43 start height, 0 as the end height, lockon as the target.
But it still fires ‘wonky’, and draws back south…

Any ideas on how i could fix this?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 23, 2007, 06:22:39 AM[/size][hr]Also, if anyone knows of a server source with working arrows that i could study, please let me know…

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @mikescott mikescott
item.description:
@mikescott wrote:

No, there are no others, apart from ogre arrows, you need to make a createprojectile(absX, absY, offsetX, offsetY, angle, speed, GfxId, startHeight, endHeight, lockon, slope); and call it through graphics handler, that createprojectile i just wrote in the quick reply box, so i doubt its right lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @bencorbett bencorbett
item.description:
@bencorbett wrote:

Yeah. Ive looked through 3 lists of gfx, and not 1 has had the correct graphic id for an arrow in the air…
I also think that ive got to somehow rotate the start projectile graphic…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 23, 2007, 05:54:30 AM[/size][hr]Does anyone have any arrow graphic ids other than these?

18: iron arrows draw back
19: bronze arrow draw back
20: steel arrow draw back
21: mith arrow draw back
22: addy arrow draw back
23: iron arrow draw back again
24: rune arrow draw back

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows in the air... (UNSOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“bencorbett, post:1, topic:167120”]Hi. I was wondering if anyone here knows how to make an arrow fly through the air.
I’m trying to implement it into my attack method if the player is using range.
I’ve seen on other servers, the arrow is loaded in the right direction, and it flys straight through the air at the enemy.

On my server, the arrow always loads facing south, no matter what direction you are facing, and instead of flying straight through the air, the graphic of the arrow loading loops, causing a weird bumpy shot.

If anyone knows ANYTHING about this, please post.
It would be… Greatly appreciated… ++

Thanks,
Unborn[/quote]
Sounds like you’ve just got an animation number wrong.

Read full topic
